meaning list.sentence translation: I whakawhiwhia ratou ki te tohu koko rakau mo te noho whakamutunga ki te whakataetae riiki.

meaning list.meaning: mahi tino pai (kwaha)
meaning list.sentence: This new cleaning product works like a charm.
meaning list.sentence translation: He pai te mahi o tenei hua horoi hou.

meaning list.meaning: E kore ahau e mahi, e noho ranei i tetahi ahuatanga (kwaha)
meaning list.sentence: I wouldn’t be caught dead wearing that outfit.
meaning list.sentence translation: E kore rawa ahau e mau i taua kakahu.

meaning list.meaning: Tukurua, ia tau, ia tau, mo nga tau (kwaha)
meaning list.sentence: They visit the same beach year in, year out.
meaning list.sentence translation: Ka haere ratou ki te one kotahi ia tau.

meaning list.meaning: he mataku, he maia (idiom)
meaning list.sentence: He’s too yellow-bellied to confront his boss.
meaning list.sentence translation: He tino mataku ia ki te tu atu ki tana rangatira.

word: you can't teach an old dog new tricks
phonetic american: juː kænt tiːʧ ən oʊld dɔːɡ nuː trɪks
phonetic british: juː kɑːnt tiːʧ ən əʊld dɒɡ njuː trɪks

meaning list.meaning: He uaua ki te huri i te tangata kua mau ona tikanga tawhito (kwaha)
meaning list.sentence: He refuses to learn how to use a smartphone; you can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
meaning list.sentence translation: Kaore ia e pai ki te ako ki te whakamahi i te waea atamai; He uaua ki te whakarereke i nga tikanga tawhito.

word: your guess is as good as mine
phonetic american: jʊr gɛs ɪz æz ɡʊd æz maɪn
phonetic british: jɔːr gɛs ɪz æz ɡʊd æz maɪn

meaning list.meaning: Kare au i te mohio, he rite tonu te tika o a maatau whakapae (kwaha)
meaning list.sentence: Why the train is late? Your guess is as good as mine.
meaning list.sentence translation: He aha te mea i roa te tereina? Kaore hoki au e mohio.
